intro: Justicia tutukuensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture, while its stems are square and somewhat hairy. Justicia tutukuensis is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of growing conditions.
